USA: The Sherman Antitrust Act is passed.
Jacob Riis publishes How the Other Half Lives.
The Sherman Silver Purchase Act is passed.
Wounded Knee massacre: The massacre takes place.
The National American Woman Suffrage Association is founded.
Tanzania: The Heligoland–Zanzibar Treaty makes Zanzibar and Pemba a British protectorate.
The Sultan of Zanzibar signs an anti-slavery decree.
Slovenia: The railway line on the route Radgona – Ljutomer is built.
Labour Day is celebrated first time.
Rwanda: Rwanda is incorporated into German East Africa.
Russia: An imperial decree subordinated the zemstva to the authority of the appointed regional governors.
Malta: Malta Railway Company Ltd. is declared bankrupt. The Malta Railway is closed.
Lebanon: The "silk crisis" took place. Cheaper and better quality Chinese silk and silk products flooded Lebanese silk's main market: Europe. The crisis was especially hard considering many had taken on large debt to expand their lands and plant mulberry trees -which leaves were used to feed the worm.
Germany: Germany and the United Kingdom signed the Heligoland–Zanzibar Treaty, under which Germany renounced its claims over Zanzibar in exchange for the strategic island of Heligoland.
Chile: The Malleco Viaduct is opened and railway traffic expands further south during the following decades.
Australia: The Australian Federation Conference called a constitutional convention.
Banjo Paterson published "The Man from Snowy River"
Argentina: Founding of the Radical Civic Union (UCR) or Radical Party
The Panic of 1890 brought the Baring Brothers bank in London close to collapse after disastrous investments in Argentina
